I hate the streams which smoothly glide</br>In channel trim with measur'd tide,</br>Whose shapely banks, for ever neat,</br>The grot adorns, or mossy seat.</br>While the calm waters, as they creep,</br>Lull the poetic mind to sleep.</br>Or where, if vagrant Fancy deigns</br>Ever to walk, she walks in chains.

No, rather eager let me haste,</br>Enthusiastic Maid!  to taste</br>Of thy belov'd, deceptive rills,</br>Which high among the Gothic hills</br>Forth from the well of Fiction spring,</br>And thence their mingled currents fling</br>O'er rocks whose heads are wreath'd in snow,</br>And thro' romantic vales below.

Th' inspiring draught my soul pervades,</br>I range through long-deserted glades,</br>With Hole, companion of my way,</br>Through scenes where Spenser lov'd to stray,</br>O'er the wild heath, or trembling sod,</br>Which Ariosto whilom trod;</br>Where the free Muse with native charms,</br>Her votary's panting bosom warms.

With him my keen undazzled sight</br>Shall trace Conagra's stormy height;</br>There the Gigantic Sisters view,</br>Their gore-drench'd robes of russet hue;</br>Behold them gird the mountain round,</br>Uttering their dire, terrific sound,</br>Exciting the loud thunder's roar,</br>Stirring the sea from shore to shore.

Now see the Magic Towers arise,</br>And Urda wrapt in dark disguise,</br>And Hengist rushing to the sight,</br>And Arthur's fierce indignant might;</br>The dreary Spectres, shrieking fell,</br>Harpies, the progeny of hell,</br>Each Shade obscene which wants a name,</br>The Moat which burns with sulphurous flame.

Now Odin's regal form behold,</br>His beaming arms, and throne of gold,</br>The vivid lightnings round him play,</br>His potent voice forbids dismay.</br>Sudden the runic rhyme I hear,</br>And orgies of th' enfrenzied Seer,</br>His strains prophetic nerve the soul,</br>The tides of war tumultuous roll.

Rapt to Biarmia's freezing skies</br>What new, portentous visions rise!</br>Valdandi, Skulda, burst the ground,</br>The icy pillars tremble round,</br>In Arthur's shape, and burnisht mail,</br>Aloft, impetuous on the gale,</br>The cloud-form'd car their Hero bears,</br>His bosom every terror dares.

What beauteous Maid, in purest white,</br>Now steals upon my ravisht sight!</br>Her brow with golden wreathe entwined,</br>Her tresses floating on the wind;</br>'Tis Inogen — with joy and love</br>Resound the bowers, and vocal grove,</br>Ambrosial blossoms deck each spray,</br>The streams o'er lucid marble play.

Deaf to the tones of modern art,</br>To song like this I ope my heart;</br>And tho' abstracted from the Muse,</br>Cannot the Lyric Note refuse.</br>For as I read, th' enchantment thrills,</br>And every sense with pleasure fills;</br>Or in attention fixt I stand,</br>As struck by Merlin's powerful wand.</br>
